Docs.summary: The SyncRoot property contains an object that can be used to synchronize access to the .
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Derived classes can provide synchronized versions of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument> using the SyncRoot property. The synchronizing code must perform operations on the SyncRoot of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument>, not directly on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument>. This ensures proper operation of collections derived from other objects. Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument> object.

Docs.returns: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the .
